lead_paragraph: Masahiro Tanaka, who had been scheduled to pitch against Tampa Bay, is instead back on the disabled list, which means the worst possible case is still in play: His problems could bleed into 2016.

headline.print_headline: A Troubling Sign as the Yankees’ Ace Is Sidelined Again
headline.main: A Troubling Sign as the Yankees’ Ace Is Sidelined Again

snippet: Masahiro Tanaka, who had been scheduled to pitch against Tampa Bay, is instead back on the disabled list, which means the worst possible case is still in play: His problems could bleed into 2016.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column assesses outlook for New York Yankees pitcher Masahiro Tanaka, who has been returned to disabled list; observes that pitcher cost team some $175 million to acquire and spent considerable time recovering from injury in rookie year.
